properties.title: Diacria
properties.text: Diacria is the name of a telescopic albedo feature located at 48째 N and 190째 E on Mars. The feature was named by Greek astronomer E. M. Antoniadi in 1930 after Diacria, the highlands around Marathon in north-west Attica, Greece. The name was approved by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) in 1958.

properties.title: Mare Acidalium
properties.text: Mare Acidalium (Acidalian Sea) is the name of a telescopic albedo feature located at 45째 N and 330째 E on Mars. The feature was named for a well or fountain in Boeotia, Greece. According to classical tradition, it is a location where Venus and the Graces bathed.[5] The name was approved by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) in 1958.

properties.title: Amazonis
properties.text: Amazonis quadrangle contains the region called Amazonis Planitia. This area is considered to be among the youngest parts of Mars because it has a very low density of craters. The Amazonia period is named after this area. This quadrangle contains special, unusual features called the Medusae Fossae Formation and Sulci.
